arts.ttl: Chelsea 2-0 Fulham: Post-Match Chelsea Player Ratings
arts.sum: After an opening goal from 18-year-old Joshua King was disallowed in a decision that was heavily disputed by Fulham's bench, Joao Pedro found the back of the net on the stroke of half-time. There was no way back for Fulham after this as Chelsea eased their way to a 2-0 victory in a much-improved second half.

arts.ttl: Marco Silva slams ‘unbelievable’ VAR decisions in Fulham’s defeat at Chelsea
arts.sum: Fulham manager despairs after King goal ruled out Silva also unhappy with penalty decision and added time Marco Silva did not hide his disgust with the officials after Fulham’s 2-0 defeat at Chelsea, saying it was “unbelievable” that a video assistant referee review led to Josh King having his first goal in senior football ruled out when the game was goalless. The head coach and Fulham were left seething after nothing went their way in a heated west London derby. They thought they were ahead when King scored in the 21st minute but the 18-year-old’s goal was ruled out after Michael Salisbury, the VAR, instructed the referee, Rob Jones, to view the pitchside monitor to assess whether Rodrigo Muniz had fouled Trevoh Chalobah during the buildup. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: 'Unbelievable': Silva slams VAR decisions following Fulham's defeat to Chelsea
arts.sum: Fulham manager Marco Silva slams the VAR decisions in Saturday's 2-0 defeat to West London rivals Chelsea at Stamford Bridge.
A look at Saturday's refereeing farce at the Bridge

arts.ttl: VAR controversy masks Chelsea's issues in win over Fulham
arts.sum: Enzo Maresca will have to concede that VAR masked a number of issues he has to address after Chelsea's win over Fulham.

arts.ttl: VAR strikes twice to fell Fulham at Stamford Bridge
arts.sum: Chelsea's 2-0 victory required seriously fortuitous officiating in a competitive game this afternoon.

arts.ttl: Enzo Fernandez shows fiery side, Liam Delap injury sparks striker crisis, and wonderkid shines - THINGS WE LEARNED from Chelsea's controversial 2-0 win over Fulham
arts.sum: KIERAN GILL: With that, Chelsea must now consider whether to enter the striker market at the eleventh hour, with Maresca saying 'we will see' amid concerns he is not blessed with options.

arts.ttl: Furious Marco Silva slams 'unbelievable' VAR decision after controversial Chelsea win
arts.sum: Fulham were beaten 2-0 by Chelsea at Stamford Bridge but the match featured a number of contentious decisions from the on-field ref and the video assistant referee

arts.ttl: Man Utd's 'disgraceful' penalty resurfaces as VAR hammered for costing Fulham at Chelsea
arts.sum: Fulham were denied the opening goal before losing to Chelsea as VAR intervened to give a controversial foul - with a similar incident involving Manchester United being referenced

arts.ttl: Marco Silva fumes at controversial decisions in Fulham loss to Chelsea: ‘As someone who loves football, I feel sad’
arts.sum: Fulham were on the receiving end of two divisive decisions in a feisty London derby
